posts.cooked:
Our FIRST robot for this year now drives “forward” to drop the coral and is working correctly.  We have added a roller unit to the “reverse” end of the robot to pick up and drop algae and that seems to be OK except you are driving in reverse.  Our driver has requested the ability to change the notion of forward to align with the task we want to do.

I can manually change the direction in the statement

m_drive.arcadeDrive( fwd , rot);

to m_drive.arcadeDrive( -1  * fwd  , rot);   and it works just fine. but would like to make the -1 a variable that can change with a button.

However I seem to be at a loss as to how to use a variable to represent the -1/+1

as in  m_drive.arcadeDrive( driveDir * fwd  , rot); where driveDir will be +1 or -1 and will be set by a button in RobotContainer.java

I’m still delving into java and find I understand a little more as time goes on but we just finished getting the algae mover unit finished on Friday and while it’s working OK as is I’d like to see if we can make this change.

What we would like to do is use a pair of buttons on the joystick (.onTrue or .toggleOnTrue) to change the direction to fit the mode we’re in.

I’ll be looking into how to do it but could use some help if someone has a suggestion.  (Competition starts next Friday)

Any help appreciated and sorry if this has an obvious answer.

posts.name: Emre
posts.cooked: Everything inside RobotContainer(another option is you can define command and variable inside your drive.java then add a button to set):

I’m sorry I didn’t communicate this very well

The m_Lifter was just an example of setting up a button.  What I want to do is modify

m_drive.arcadeDrive( driveDir * fwd , rot)

to let me change which direction is “the front” of the robot since the coral drop is on one end and the algae pickup/drop is on the other.

I studied your original suggestions some more and put

private boolean feedForwardReverseEnabled = false; and public Command setFeedforwardDirection() { return Commands.runOnce( () → { feedForwardReverseEnabled = !feedForwardReverseEnabled ; }); }

in DriveSubsystem

I couldn’t get the trigger to work so I put the  following

in its place.

I get no errors in compile and deploy but it doesn’t seem to change the feedForwardReverseEnabled boolean to switch front and back

I got involved in a lot of other stuff today but will get back to it tomorrow.  I tried to do some System.out.print(); (println) but they didn’t seem to show things as the program executed but just printed a whole bunch of printer output at much later arbitrary times.

Thanks again

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
robojack:

doesn’t seem to change

It’s hard to know for sure with your code not complete or continuous but I’d guess you put that arcadeDrive in a place that is executed only once when your robot starts and thus the values never change from those initial values. Your decision about which arcadeDrive to use has to be associated with something that changes dynamically such as a Supplier or Lambda expression. If in a Command factory, then don’t forget the statements before the return statement are executed once likely when the robot is started and the statements in the return are executed dynamically as you request the Command or Runnable.

posts.name: Emre
posts.cooked: I don’t understand your codebase. Can you share github link?

After doing some debugging, I think I realized my problem and will try to work on it this afternoon.  If that works, I’ll post again about the false paths I went down.

I think you were right about the arcade drive change being made in the wrong spot and I see why that didn’t work.  If my new understanding is right, I know where to put the code to do what I want to do.

Thanks
